title: Jessica Alba shows off her tough side as she pulls out a gun while filming LA's Finest
text:
Jessica Alba's series LA Finest is getting ready to return next year.

So the actress, 38, was hard at work on Monday when she was seen filming an action-packed scene for the Spectrum original show on set in Downtown Los Angeles.

The mother-of-three was in full character, grimacing before she pulled a gun from her waistband as cameras rolled.

Tough cookie: Jessica Alba looked tough while on the set of her show LA's Finest on Monday in Downtown LA

For her role, Jessica was dressed in a comfortable and stylish combo that consisted of a dark blazer, tee shirt and cuffed, distressed mom jeans with combat boots.

Alba, who plays Detective Lieutenant Nancy McKenna on the show, flashed her police badge on her belt.

Proving her character was the practical type, she had her hair swept out of her face into a high ponytail.

Still, her look had a feminine touch courtesy of some earring and some well-defined contour.

Dressed down: For her role, Jessica was dressed in a comfortable and stylish combo that consisted of a dark blazer, tee shirt and cuffed, distressed mom jeans with combat boots

Gotcha! She continued to put on a tough face in another scene, where she was seen tackling a suspect

She continued to put on a tough face in another scene, where she was seen tackling a salt-and-pepper haired suspect, who looked like the definition of a white collar criminal.

Between takes, Jessica brushed up on her lines, seen skimming a few pages of the script while checking her phone.

Not seen on set: friend and co-star Gabrielle Union.

Multi-tasking: Between takes, Jessica brushed up on her lines, seen skimming a few pages of the script while checking her phone

LA's Finest is an offshoot of the Bad Boys franchise, depicting Union's original character Special Agent/Detective Lieutenant Sydney 'Syd' Burnett as she deals with being transferred from the DEA to the LAPD.

The buddy cop procedural drama was renewed this past June after being the first piece of premium content released by Spectrum.

In addition to Alba and Union, it also stars Duane Martin, Zach Gilford, Ryan McPartlin, Sophie Reynolds, and Ernie Hudson.
